website_summaries.verdict: Designed for Japanese-style lunches (soup, rice, fruit, etc.), but adaptable to portion-controlled American lunch items. Metal lunch jar can be preheated or chilled as needed.
pros: Insulated bottom bowl keeps soups piping hot for hours
Can be used as a food cooler as well
Includes a useful metal spork as well as chopsticks
cons: Individual plastic bowls described as flimsy
Containers can retain and transfer strong food odors

customer_reviews.title: Allows for more lunch options!!
customer_reviews.text: Food remained warm for at least 9 hours. Item appears to be made well. Wasn't sure that the containers were big enough but they ended up to be adiquate for individual use. Would like to see other designs in the future. Containers held Salisbury steak, mashed potatoes, salad, pineapple, brisket, tortilla. My husband was very pleased with product and was happy to have something other than a cold sandwich. I packed leftovers in the containers and put in fridge, then microwaved food in their containers right before he left for work.
customer_reviews.author: kristy

customer_reviews.title: Warning:  Locking Latch is Designed Poorly - Breaks
customer_reviews.text: WARNING: Great concept and has worked well until today. The locking latch broke after about only 1 month. Now I have to try to get a replacement through Zojirushi. I certainly would find it unreasonable if i have to pay to replace the part. What a hassle. I wish this was not the case. Update: I called Zojirushi's customer service and as noted by other reviewers there is not a warranty for the locking mechanism only the thermal aspect of the container. Absurd. I should have noted this before purchasing. The plastic tab on the latch should be metal to avoid breaking so easily or designed to be replaced, if needed. Functionally flawed in that aspect. Money out the window.
customer_reviews.author: Poor Ol' Johnny Ray

customer_reviews.title: Keeps food hot!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because we're currently not allowed to use the microwaves at work due to COVID. Each individual container is small, but they add up so you have a full meal packed. I pack my lunch every night and stick it in the fridge. Then, every morning at 7:30 I reheat it in the microwave before I leave for work; I eat my lunch around 1-1:30 and my food is still hot! You don't have to use the bottom container for soup to keep everything warm, but you do have to have something in there.
customer_reviews.author: Dianne P.

customer_reviews.title: Good if you want hot food and don't mind cleaning up a mess
customer_reviews.text: To start, it really does keep food warm, which I really appreciate when packing lunch in the winter. The bad is that when I use the bottom container for soup, it almost always winds up all over the place. I'm not sure if it's an issue with the gasket, but even when my son doesn't eat the soup, there's always a good amount of it that winds up in the bottom of the outer jar. To add to this, it's pretty annoying to have to dismantle the lower container after each lunch. the middle valve is not so bad, but I find myself having to jam something (a chop stick works well) into the container to dig out the gasket.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Priceless for transporting high school kid volumes of food
customer_reviews.text: This is our 2nd one, bought it as a backup as our son uses this every day for high school lunches. Great for keeping food warm and transporting enough food to feed a high schooler (i.e., a lot...). Just need to wash it by hand, otherwise these will warp and/or the insulated lid will come apart. It's not lightweight per se, but it's definitely heavy duty. Pair it with a spork (yes, he actually prefers that so we have a pack of those as well) and you're good to go.
customer_reviews.author: EricY

customer_reviews.title: I am always looking for ways to easily and safely pack both hot & cold foods for ...
customer_reviews.text: As a food allergy mom, I am always looking for ways to easily and safely pack both hot & cold foods for my allergic child. We recently took this on a trip to the mountains and despite sitting in a car parked in a snow and ice filled lot, this kept my kid's pasta hot for hours. Holds quite a bit of food too! Even saw steam when I opened it. I also highly recommend the travel coffee mugs from this same manufacturer. Great products!!
customer_reviews.author: Hike4Health

customer_reviews.title: #1 out of my 5 lunch bags/systems.
customer_reviews.text: This is my favorite lunch /bento box. Keeps food warm or cold,not hot. Takes up little space, has room for enough food for my average 12 hour work day. Sometimes I fit breakfast, lunch, 2 evening snacks in it. (Yogurt, lunch,fruit (snack),and nuts and pretzels (10 hour mark snack at work) I am a woman, and I found the mr. Bento more beneficial for me for working long hours than the smaller ms. Bento (too small for my needs) got this for less than $40.00 ,but the price changes often. I would purchase from this seller again.
customer_reviews.author: Mab

customer_reviews.title: makes lunch easier
customer_reviews.text: This is the second one of these purchased for the household--the first one was bought about 4 years ago. It does not leak in the least, keeps food to temperature, and easily pays for itself after a week or so taking lunch from home (depending, of course, on how expensive lunch out is in your area.) the only drawback: over time, the lids become more and more difficult to open and close, especially if you have small hands or any problems like arthritis. I think they've warped from heating. But strong hands shouldn't have too much of a problem with them. Very happy with this lunch box.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon O'Brien

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Works perfect it keeps the food hot for up to 6h but food needs to be heat up on stove in a pot or pan not in de microwave the only down side is that the plastic containers got stain on the first time used and can't get the stain away
customer_reviews.author: Leonidas

customer_reviews.title: Ive been using this exactly for 2 years... And it's AMAZING!!
customer_reviews.text: It really does keep the heat for 12 hours long!! Crazy because I've been using it for school and work. I like to cook my own food and this helps me avoid ever using the nasty public Chef Mic. which smells awful which I'm sure everyone knows. This Japanese ingenuity allows me to pack my food neatly with all the good compartment. I originally bought this for my dad but he's a stubborn fool for not using it haha, so I've been using it ever since.
customer_reviews.author: Ericson V.

customer_reviews.title: Great but...!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a lunch box for my daughter in high school. She was tired of the cold lunch (fried cafeteria food so not an option). It keeps definitely the 2 bottoms container warm but unfortunately the 2 upper containers do not stay cold. After about 5 hours anything inside the 2 upper containers is at room temperature. I decided to fill one of the container with water and freeze it so I can use it as an "ice pack" to keep the food cold. Doing so I am "loosing" that container but at least the remaining container stays cold.
customer_reviews.author: Mylene Primard

customer_reviews.title: I really like zojirushi stuff
customer_reviews.text: I really like zojirushi stuff. Everything i have from them is just great. Those is the first insulated food container I've ever had, so i might not know that there's better stuff out there, and i might be a zoji fan, so this review might be biased but it's honest! First of, it keeps food hot. Hot (OK maybe it's just very warm) miso and rice after five hours, pretty impressive. Second, the portion sizes are healthy. I don't have to worry about not having enough space to pack food for a picnic for my toddler and I. My only gripe is that it's not dishwasher safe. Otherwise i find myself looking for excuses to use it.
customer_reviews.author: LoRoK

customer_reviews.title: Does not stay warm & leaks
customer_reviews.text: Followed the directions but the food cooled down quickly and leaked. Retuned. Seems like a good idea but the liquids bowl is very small and the other ‘hot’ bowl can’t have anything unless it’s completely dry. I had a ground beef mixture (thought it was dry) in it and the little grease that was in it leaked out of that bowl and the big container.
customer_reviews.author: Dempsey de Brazil

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality Plastic and NO Customer Support
customer_reviews.text: After 2 months of use one of the clips broke during normal use, I clipped the lid on. I contacted Zojirushi via the customer support links provided to PURCHASE a replacement clip, not ask for freebies. I was informed that the warranty only applies to the vacuum seal and nothing else. With the poor quality clips that break almost immediately they have guaranteed to not have to deal with any warranty claims because the bento box becomes irrelevant once the lid no longer stays on. - Save yourself the trouble and choose another brand.
customer_reviews.author: JustinT

customer_reviews.title: Purchased in 2005, still great today
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this in 2005 and was looking for another one (my wife ended up loving it and takes it to work with her). It's the perfect size for portion control, has 4 separate compartments and comes with a bag and chopsticks. I added a spork/knife combo and it's perfect for us both. I could not recommend this more.
customer_reviews.author: Bill_shops_too_much

customer_reviews.title: Too small for adults and doesn't keep food warm.
customer_reviews.text: It doesn't keep food warm long enough and it's on the smaller side for a male adult's lunch box. Its too late for me to return it so I just use the compartments. Also, I experienced leakage 80% of the time so i always have to wrap anything with gravy with a ceram wrap.
customer_reviews.author: clhamo

customer_reviews.title: Nearly perfect lunch box
customer_reviews.text: My Mr. Bento's have had years of hard use with two active growing teen boys needing large lunches. This lunch box is about perfect for our needs. Still, it is worth mentioning I can't easily fit a full sized spoon or fork inside the canister - my kids carry them to school in their backpacks and mostly ignore the carry case that would take their utensils. And pro-tip: I frequently use 5" diameter 1.5" deep round silicone ramekins as flexible alternatives to the original containers that allow a partition to take a bump from a juice box or apple! (The original Zojirushi containers are still in very good condition.)
customer_reviews.author: Mark Stephens

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size for young kids.
customer_reviews.text: I only use Zojirushi . Its amazing products. I have 3rd grade boy. Last week I ordered Zojirushi SL-JAE14SA Mr. Bento for him. I worried about that size of jar. I was right. It is too big for that 9 years old kid. So I will return that soon then I ordered this smaller size than Zojirushi SL-JAE14SA Mr. Bento. This is perfect size for him may be 2more years??😅😅 I recommend it for elementary kids.
customer_reviews.author: Sunny day

customer_reviews.title: Unusable
customer_reviews.text: Came in a crushed box, the ring is set on side ways, lid does not screw on to the container. Worthless
customer_reviews.author: W. Wu

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my instapot
customer_reviews.text: I use this at work. I usually bring meat, rice, fruit and nuts for 4 compartments. I dont have to microwave the food. My female coworker saw it and says that's better for her baby since they travel and she doesnt want to use microwave a lot. She wants to buy one. My niece currently using it. I want to buy the classic one.
customer_reviews.author: Fernan Borromeo

customer_reviews.title: One of the containers doesn't open
customer_reviews.text: I loved this product at first but quickly tired of struggling to open the larger container for hot food. It gets vacuum sealed because of the heat, which means that I have to wait for the food to cool before the seal can be broken. Kind of defeats the whole purpose. Love the concept and would give this five stars if that container could easily open once it contains hot food. Oh well.
customer_reviews.author: teacherusa

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny!!
customer_reviews.text: I love this lunch box so much that I don't mind that it's not dishwasher safe. It actually holds too much food for me but it's perfect for my husband. They've made fun of him at work until he opens it and see what's inside. I've put all types of food in here and it's great to have warm food for lunch. Now it's not going to be as warm as when you cooked it but it's better than other lunch options. I plan on getting the three compartment version soon.
customer_reviews.author: Loribelle

customer_reviews.title: Great design and VERY durable!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in 2008 and it still works perfectly!! No leaks, keeps my food cold until lunch time. The four containers hold a lot of food! In fact, I usually put my breakfast in one container, snacks in another and then lunch items in the other two. I keep the outer, stainless steel container in the freezer overnight and that helps it keep the food cold. And the satchel is just right! It's durable, has a pocket on the outside, a cool metal spork with case on the inside, and the zipper/strap/cinch cord are a smart combo! Sometimes I even stash a little something on top of the container, inside the satchel. I highly recommend this one!
customer_reviews.author: drumrgrrrl

customer_reviews.title: Over Time, a Money-Saver
customer_reviews.text: Considering how much eating out every day costs, this food jar will pay for itself within weeks. As an example, my current place of employment has an onsite, mini-market vending which charges $6 for sandwiches. Using Mr. Bento, I am able to bring 2 wraps, 8 oz. of soup, and 8 oz of yogurt for the same price. Similar savings can be realized by cooking, freezing and portioning out dinner-for-two meals.
customer_reviews.author: Philo Yeager

customer_reviews.title: Look good but..it doesn't work is you like soup!
customer_reviews.text: I researched many products like this. I'm a woman but I like to eat well. I feel disappointed with this purchase. The base container is to small for soup, I use the second last one but the soup leaks. the 3er container no keeps food hot so I fill with fruit. The small container in the top is useful. Looks good quality, and fancy jar but it doesn't work for me
customer_reviews.author: Sonia Castro

customer_reviews.title: Not really such a good design
customer_reviews.text: You really have to choose either hot or cold. The thick lid that is supposed to keep hot food from heating cold food on top really does not do that. I had hot food on the bottom and cold yogurt on top. by lunch, yogurt was warm. I want to like this but it really does not work that well. I was going on the companies reputation of their thermal cook which is the best on the mark. This lunch box is another issue
customer_reviews.author: Me

customer_reviews.title: Great for travelers or others without access to microwaves or fridges
customer_reviews.text: I know what you're thinking $40 for a lunchbox? Well, people are spending that on just a cup these days, so by that measure, these are a complete steal! When I was traveling a lot I used to use this for long days in airplanes. Heat up a nice meal and toss it in your backpack when you leave in the morning, a couple flights later, forget about the crappy airplane food or overpriced McDonald's from the airport - pull out your salad, rice and meat - then watch all the jealousy around you. This set kept some chicken that I heated up warm for a solid 4 hours!
customer_reviews.author: Jonnio

customer_reviews.title: Great lunch set
customer_reviews.text: I like the product, it keeps the food warm even till afternoon. The only down side is that the largest container might be difficult to open sometimes as it is very easily effected by the suction of the liquid inside.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Hope you're VERY hungry
customer_reviews.text: This thing holds a LOT of food. It will easily hold a meal for two. The hot stuff at the bottom stays nice and hot. The heat from that container will also warm the food in the adjacent container. The outer container is quite large so don't expect to be able to just throw it in the bottom of a purse or something. I carry a messenger bag and I attach this guy to the strap of my messenger bag. This is a quality product. It's sturdy and well made. The seals seem to work as they're supposed to, the metal and plastic are very thick, and I think it will last for a very long time.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Amazing product!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this product since in work out and about all day for a utility company. I needed something that would keep my food warm throughout the day. I have used it once so far, but i am very happy. I preheated the item as suggested with hot water, then i put some chili in the large food bowl. I put a bit of rice in the upper portion of the container. I did this at 6 am. I ate my lunch at 2pm, and was extremely happy and almost shocked at how warm the chili still was. HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS PRODUCT!!!!
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Bigger bag carrier
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Bento from Zojirushi, and I still own my first Bento which is a little smaller than this. Works well for me to bring a set of food for my lunch and small snacks in between. But I would love to have a little bigger carrier bag so I can put my water bottle too...
customer_reviews.author: Tara Neuheisel

customer_reviews.title: OK food carrier
customer_reviews.text: Updated on 06/2016: The more I use it the more I realize I need something spill and leak proof. The lids are tight, but not tight enough. The good thing is that whatever leaks is contained inside of the cylinder. So I don't have to worry about anything leaking in my vehicle. The only reason I didn't give it five stars is because only one container is spill or water proof. The lids are tight, but just be careful. Other than that, the portion sizes are good. The carry bag is good also.
customer_reviews.author: ACE

customer_reviews.title: Could be better
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like this. They are going to be remodeling our offices, so temporarily moving us to a space where we won't have access to a refrigerator or a microwave. This made it critical to find something so that lunchtime will consist of something more than sandwiches. When I first opened it, I was impressed, thinking ... wow ... I'll be able to bring some decent lunches. But for the life of me, I could not open the soup bowl. Even my husband couldn't get it open. I am disappointed, but after looking at other reviews, have decided to just return it. Now ... off to find something else that will fit the bill.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it.
customer_reviews.text: I've had problems with the soup container leaking for some time now. Simply put, it always leaks. Unfortunately, the containers are not covered by the warranty. After some time, the plastic has absorbed the smells of food and now things taste sour. I didn't have this issue with my Classic Bento so I'm disappointed that I "upgraded."
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Very nice, but..
customer_reviews.text: So I am very disappointed with my Bento Box. I love it, BUT, it already broke. I've had it for about two weeks now and the snap part on the lid to close the whole box broke so now only one side clicks in. It is also very small, so if it is something you plan on putting meals in for the whole day I would pack proteins/grains. I am just very sad it already broke ... I hate giving it three stars.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lifesaver for those with food allergies
customer_reviews.text: This is a lifesaver if you have a child with food allergies. My son is allergic to wheat and became tired of sandwiches on gluten-free bread very quickly. He started requesting to eat in the school cafeteria, and that is not an option.. Now I can pack rice with teriyaki chicken, spaghetti sauce and noodles, and other lunches he loves. Fruit fits in the top container so he has a healthy dessert to finish his lunch with. It comes home empty every day. I am very happy with this product.,
customer_reviews.author: Carob7307

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: Got this last week, a quite a few days prior to determined delivery date. Original packaging, great readable instructions. I would advise (as per instructions) that you need to make sure that the soup bowl contains hot liquid at all time in order to create the heat retention. I've used it a few time since and there as been no leakage, packing my lunch at 6:30am and by 12:30 it wasn't piping hot but comfortably hot/warm to heat. This beats lining-up for the microwave and heating up your lunch. Reducing waiting time on a short lunch time and limiting the time you eat zapped food. And you get to eat home made healthy food and rightly portioned.
customer_reviews.author: Chantal P.

customer_reviews.title: ... using this for a while now and I really enjoy using it
customer_reviews.text: Been using this for a while now and I really enjoy using it. The container looks nice and keeps food warm until i get to my lunch time (which is about 6 hours). The container is also easy to clean and the pouches on the side of the bag can be used to hold granola bars or flavored packets for water. My only complaint with it is that the "main bowl" is not airtight so storing something like pasta or chili which are a bit liquidy, might spill out. However when it did spill out there wasn't that much and it was easy to clean anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Derek

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this. They sent me a used one.
customer_reviews.text: This is no joke. I bought this and a freaking USED one arrived. I'm 100% sure this is used because the 3rd compartment of this Mr. Bento smelled like marinara sauce. The pictures are taken right after I opened the box. It was hard to take the outer surface of the Mr. Bento so I didn't put it up, but it was not clean. WASTE OF MONEY. DON'T BUY THIS.
customer_reviews.author: zenatoss

customer_reviews.title: Zojirushi Bento
customer_reviews.text: Just opened the package in the past hour, while the overall construction seems impressive, I do have concerns over the history of the product that I purchased. My understanding is that I was purchasing a new product. Upon opening the canister and pulling out each bowl, I noticed considerable scratches on the lids and even waterspots on at least one lid. Upon opening the lids, I noticed a quaint smell of food in at least two of the bowls. I plan to keep anyways and wash it thoroughly, however this is a poor reflection on product sales.
customer_reviews.author: Roger Seeton

customer_reviews.title: Lovely portions lunch
customer_reviews.text: I take this to work where I don't have a fridge or microwave. So this has been a lifesaver. Oh, what I have done to help the soup bowl with the leak problem. Is put a fat rubber band on the soup bowl, then when the cover twists on it will seal tight.
customer_reviews.author: Niiyah

customer_reviews.title: Best lunch container we have...and we have a lot!!
customer_reviews.text: great product. Kept my kid eating healthy for several years throughout middle school. She looked forward to her lunch. She had a variety of fooods(leftovers from previous nights dinner). Liquids did not spill. Hot foods remained hot. The school she goes to now does not have lockers and its hard for her to carry this around for 5.5 hours before lunch but its really a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Jaya's notes

customer_reviews.title: Great lunch box
customer_reviews.text: It's probably worth mentioning that I have no interest in creating traditional bento boxes. I am not going to spend a ton of time making cherry tomatoes into lady-bugs only to eat them later. I use this for holding food and snacks, for which it is excellent. Keeps food warm or cold, but is microwaveable. Spillage doesn't seem to be an option. If you will not have access to a microwave, and are more interested in heat retention, then go with the tiffin jar. That one (by zojirushi) is not microwaveable but does retain heat a big better than this one.
customer_reviews.author: Eztli

customer_reviews.title: The material is good, I like it overall
customer_reviews.text: The material is good, I like it overall, it does keep warm for 4-5hrs. Never tried longer than that. There are two things I don't like. I buy it for my 4yrs to bring lunch to preschool. For the 15oz (largest) container inside, only adult is able to open the lid, even I have hard time to turn it open, the container needs to be very oil free outside. For the 9oz container, there was once after we microwaved the food hot to put it, the lid got suck in (physically) and is out of shape now to use. Wonder if they can make the material strong enough to prevent this from happening.
customer_reviews.author: Phik L.

customer_reviews.title: Very good so far
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this for 2 months now. Everything's perfect and nice. The only issue I found is that if you heat up the container in the microwave for too long, the lid distorts, and it will not completely shut. Just don't over heat these containers.

customer_reviews.title: Bento seems good but package was missing pieces
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my daughter to take to school for lunch. It looks like it will work great however, while it came in “original packaging” the instruction manual and the carry bag were not included. Thought I was getting the complete product so will likely return unless resolved.
customer_reviews.author: aabern5

customer_reviews.title: Mr. Bento is awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Like all of the Zojirushi product line, Mr. Bento is extremely well made and performs as advertised. All of the containers seal and work flawlessly. The insulated bowls do a great job of keeping hot items hot and cold items cold. The spork is self contained in a plastic sheath inside of the durable carrying bag, so no worries about getting any extra mess or having any unexpected cleanups at the end of the day. All in all, this is a really nicely designed product that goes a great way towards you being able to pack a convenient and healthy lunch on the go.
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: I wanted to love it, but just didn't keep the food warm
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to love the Mr. Bento. I wanted my wife to take Salmon to work with some rice and not have her piss off all of her co workers with that horrible head turning who burnt the microwave popcorn, spam email forming, start throwing the Swinglines around smell. Did just like the directions said, even added boiling water to the bowl and the liner and 5 hours later cold salmon. Yuck. It may be ok for sushi, but not for us. Sorry I love Zojirushi products, but this one doesn't cut the fish.
customer_reviews.author: The Chupacabra

customer_reviews.title: Hands Down The Best Lunch Box On The Planet!
customer_reviews.text: You don't have to just do bento in this. It keeps your soups hot, your meats cool, veggies crisp. You have a soup bowl (enough for a cup of soup), an insulated bowl (rice, beans, casserole, etc.), two more uninsulated bowls that you can put veggies, fruit slices, etc. in. (Heat, Cold retention is amazing) and best of all, absolutely no leaking. The best quality and workmanship, it is a Zojirushi!!!!! Yeah, there are many alternatives that do not cost as much but, this is one investment I do not regret making and will be pleased and using the set for many, many, many years to come!
customer_reviews.author: T. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Great concept, broke with first use.
customer_reviews.text: Worked great the first and only day it was used. Then I found the band at the top of the bottom piece broken so the cap can't be latched on. Now a useless bunch of plastic. Very disappointed by this as it wasn't a cheap item!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great.
customer_reviews.text: I spend a lot of time driving to and from customer sites and decided to start bringing my lunch instead of eating out so much. This set is fantastic. It holds a nice meal and the insulated compartments keep the contents warm all day. It is nice to be able to sit down to a hot meal. The spork that is included with the set is actually servicable! I am rapidly becoming a fan of Zojirushi and this lunch kit is just another example of why.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Purvis

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed. Leaks
customer_reviews.text: I was stoked for this Bento box. The sizes are great portions, and it does exactly what it says as far as keeping things cool/warm, etc. However, the containers leak. I haven't tried soup yet, but just in doing my tuna salad, or veggie salads, every time I open the container, there is liquid everywhere. I make sure to screw everything on tight, and I do not rest the container on its side. It remains upright. The only time it shifts is when its in my bag on my commute to work. Disappointed it leaks after I spend that much money!
customer_reviews.author: Kimbre Lancaster

customer_reviews.title: Work very good product  keep the food hot for along time .
customer_reviews.text: Great quality I wish was more easy to open some lid top of the big container it’s very difficult to open . But so far the quality is very good and keep the food hot for along time .

customer_reviews.title: I recommend everyone to choose this product
customer_reviews.text: I can’t believe it. It was better than I thought. It stays warmer for 9 hours. and it's lightweight and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Minh Dinh

customer_reviews.title: Does what it says it does!
customer_reviews.text: This does keep things quite warm for several hours. Obviously, the soup container (in the bottom) should contain nice piping hot soup when you put it in for it to stay warm and it helps a great deal if the container above it is filled densely with something hot, too. The second to top layer is good for vegetables that don't mind being a little warm -- carrots, cukes, peppers -- and I'll put anything into the top container. It's a beautiful container and easy to clean, and the bag and spork are well made, too.
customer_reviews.author: letterm

customer_reviews.title: Nom nom!
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my fiance as the cafeteria food at his work is pretty dubious. I really enjoy making embarrassing cute Bento lunches for him, and the containers are perfect for that. Lots of space, and the food stays at a good temp. I've used many Bento's, and consider myself a cute (kawaii) lunch enthusiast, and I have to say that Mr. Bento is the best! This Bento used to come with chopsticks in a case, but now has a spork type thing. Would prefer the chopsticks, but no big thing. Oh, and the bag is pretty decent. I can sometimes squeeze a fruit in there, and I always leave a note!
customer_reviews.author: Steph

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased
customer_reviews.text: Works really well and does not leak. The plastics used for the inside containers will gently stain from red sauces and will not come out after repeated washings. Despite this, it is used nearly daily with positive results. Food stays hot. This is our second purchase and the first one needed replacement from continual use and 8 year old abuse. Would definitely purchase again. Very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Davis

customer_reviews.title: Reminds me of my school days
customer_reviews.text: I used to use these Zojirushi bentos during my childhood.. I bought one for my husband so that I could pack warm lunch for my husband in winter as well.. Soups remain very hot inside this lunch box.. I use the bottom compartment for soup, middle one for rice or buns, and the top one for side dishes..
customer_reviews.author: pico

customer_reviews.title: He doesn’t have to waste time waiting in a long line to heat his ...
customer_reviews.text: My son has dietary restrictions so I bought this for him to take his lunch to work. He absolutely loves it. His food stays as warm as when it was just heated in the early morning. He doesn’t have to waste time waiting in a long line to heat his lunch.
customer_reviews.author: volleyballmom

customer_reviews.title: Excellent "lunch box"
customer_reviews.text: So, the most important thing to know about this.. it works quite well. The second most important thing to know, it's sometimes too much and sometimes too little for your meal. In other words, you have to portion appropriately to use it. :) Overall it is very well constructed, provides either a warm or a cold meal for hours (but not both), and even comes with a nice metal spoon. Can't go wrong here although I do wish it had a better way of carrying it. The bag is okay, but it's a bit awkward at times.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Fast and skip microwave
customer_reviews.text: A lot easier and saving time wait to heating up the food at microwave. its already include a metallic spork and carrying bag.
customer_reviews.author: Klaus Heisler

customer_reviews.title: Very cool
customer_reviews.text: I work a lot of 16 hour shifts where I am not allowed to leave my work site. This Bento box is awesome. If you fill it with cold foods it will keep them cold all day. The same with hot foods. The build quality is superior as all products manufactured by Zojirushi are. And not to mention it is just plain cool. My only complaint is that the cups are a little small. This is not your ever day lunchbox but if you are looking to bring a dedicated meal to work and keep it warm all day than this is for you.
customer_reviews.author: J Gage

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Holds a good amount of food for a meal and is easy to clean. Nice having the side pockets on the carrying case for napkins or smaller snacks. I can fit it into my backpack but it does take up a good amount of space. It does maintain the temperature very well, but sometimes with a cost. The food that you are trying to keep warm typically goes on the bottom, and heat rises. So food that you are trying to keep cooler in the upper containers do get a bit warm; I've had Spinach with cheese in a container and the Spinach started to shrink and cheese melt (Still tasted good, but you get the point).
customer_reviews.author: William F

customer_reviews.title: Larger than you think!
customer_reviews.text: I was worried this wouldn't hold enough food, however if you take an entire plate of food and put it in this container your going to have room to spare! Even large portions would fit easily with extra room. If your not used to measuring food this is a great way to start. Excellent product!
customer_reviews.author: Review-er

customer_reviews.title: Great lunchbox
customer_reviews.text: Love it. Keeps the hubbys lunch warm. Should have gotten years ago. Pack a warm lunch at 6:00 am and stays super warm until 12 or 1. I always pack a soup at the bottom to keep everything warm at the top. Make sure you keep the warm foods in the two bottom compartments. 🥘
customer_reviews.author: Carmonator

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't Keep Food Warm
customer_reviews.text: Overall, this is a nice product, except for one thing. It will not keep food warm. It's only rated for an ambient temperature of ~70 degrees, which is pretty lame for a name like Zojirushi. If you want to keep food warm in freezing ambient temperatures, keep looking...
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Sparkie

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product!
customer_reviews.text: You gotta love zojirushi. They put out quality products. Never disappoints. Thermos keep everything hot throughout the day. Came with a spork, which is super convenient! Buy buy buy!
customer_reviews.author: Romans109

customer_reviews.title: Spacious, attractive, and soooo useful.
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my lunches, as I work 12-16 hour night shifts. Nothing is open @ my dinner time (around 1 a.m. in a small town!) Tons of space, but bulky. Wish I'd bought the Ms. Bento instead, to reduce weight and bulk, but it's beautifully designed and I can fit an enormous amount of food. I especially like using the snack sized package for scrambled eggs/bacon so I've got a breakfast before the long commute home.
customer_reviews.author: Misty L. Benefield

customer_reviews.title: Still going strong after 10 years!
customer_reviews.text: I have had this set for ten years at this point. The "leak proof" part has declined over time, but again, that's over ten years with fairly regular use. I pack my lunch at about 5:30 in the morning and eat it at about 11am. The hot food stays acceptably warm and cold food stays cold. Can't ask for better.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Bergman

customer_reviews.title: Easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: Easy to clean. The bowls look small but capacity is amazingly sufficient for young men. Only trouble is the large bowl. The lid is hard to open. Once we put congee - rice cooked in lots of water and the lid just cannot be open. I thought Zojirushi always had very thoughtful products. Seemed that they could improve on that part.
customer_reviews.author: Tianrenheyi

customer_reviews.title: You need to get one of these...
customer_reviews.text: Cautious consumers, we had our doubts to the product claims. We bought one to test and ended up buying a second one just hours after our daughter came home from school and told us her lunch was not warm...but hot. These will allow us to provide home-cooked nutritious meals to our girls everyday rather than buying into the dubious public school lunch program. The jars are durable, easy to clean and work exactly as advertised. As a bonus, these jars delivered piece of mind that money cannot buy. Nicely done UPDATE: Nice while is lasted. Not dishwasher safe for the long-haul and plastic pieces gave-way. If the composites improve this COULD be the invention of our generation.
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: Not impressive
customer_reviews.text: The food is rather warm NOT hot, it is easy to clean but grease stains remain
customer_reviews.author: IG

customer_reviews.title: my fiance loves this.
customer_reviews.text: i bought this as a gift for my fiance and he loves it. he is a paramedic so he works long, busy shifts. he says this product keeps his hot food warm and his cold food cool all shift. it is also very conveniently packaged so it's easy to carry around. we threw out his old bulky thermal lunch bag. there are two hot containers and two cold. it does not hold huge portions of food. it is perfect for one person but if you eat huge portions or are packing for two, they do offer a bigger one.
customer_reviews.author: Caroline Ahn

customer_reviews.title: A worthwhile investment in the fine art of lunch boxing...
customer_reviews.text: It's excellent for determining meal portions as well as maintaining reasonably consistent temperature. I've noticed that past 6 hours though, the food begins to cool off, which is to be expected. However, it most definitely retain its warmth and flavor well. It's often helpful to use vinegar and baking soda when cleaning out some of the containers to get rid of lingering food odors. A month in, it's still in excellent condition.
customer_reviews.author: The Hammer

customer_reviews.title: This Bento system is one of the best investments I've made for eating healthy
customer_reviews.text: This Bento system is one of the best investments I've made for eating healthy. I love it so much I bought one for my girlfriend. Pros: Forces portion control and thought into what I want to eat throughout the day. Cons: The middle, insulated container leaks liquid - I learned this the hard way when I packed salmon into this container, and it leaked everywhere when I accidentally tipped the closed Bento on its side. What a surprise I had when I opened the bag for lunch.
customer_reviews.author: Kansas

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: This lunch thermos is all you need. Even after container empty it stay warm over hours. LOVE IT. I WISH IT WAS A LITTLE CHEAPER I WOULD PURCHASE A PORTION FOR GIFTS. BUT THEY SAID IF U WANT GOOD U NOSE AV TO RUN. SO IT'S WORTH IT.
customer_reviews.author: Primay Myers-Barnes

customer_reviews.title: perfect
customer_reviews.text: My two children want to take lunch to school every day, the first consideration is the thermal effect of lunch box, the second is the number of lunch boxes should be enough for the children to eat, finally chose the elephant seal thermal insulation lunch box is very satisfied, the children said the lunch is hot at noon.
customer_reviews.author: Li

customer_reviews.title: It works like a charm
customer_reviews.text: Brought this when I needed it to bring lunch to work without having to walk upstairs to the microwave. It works like a charm. The food is prepared at 8:00 in the morning and it stays warm when I eat it at 1:00 PM. Just remember to preheat the whole container with hot water before you use it for about 10 minutes or the food does cool down a lot faster.
customer_reviews.author: Christine

customer_reviews.title: Great to Bring Lunch to Office and/or School
customer_reviews.text: Great at keeping food at good temperature (warm or cold). Wish the soup bowl was a little bigger.
customer_reviews.author: Benedicto H.

customer_reviews.title: You can fit a couple meals in this!
customer_reviews.text: Very well designed. This was a gift to my daughter. A couple days a week she works all day and then has meetings in the evening till 8 pm and she likes to take food from home to eat. She was amazed at the amount of food Mr Bento held and liked that it fit in her pack.
customer_reviews.author: babu1213

customer_reviews.title: Neat Lunch Box
customer_reviews.text: The quality of the product is excellent. Feels sturdy, well built, and does not give off any plastic smell. The best part is that it has two heat zones - bottom is for anything you want to keep hot or cold, and the top is for anything room temperature (crackers, sauce, etc.). It comes with a nice carrying pouch. Spork and a spork guard is included. SWEET! I liked it so much I am buying one more. Did I mention it comes in different colors!??! :-O
customer_reviews.author: Kris Starr

customer_reviews.title: I m very satisfied with the purpose it serves which is keeping the ...
customer_reviews.text: I M using Bento for last 8 months now. I m very satisfied with the purpose it serves which is keeping the food hot. If I pack the lunch at 7am, it's still warm by lunch time around 1 pm. I typically use it to pack rice and curry. The curry goes in the bottom bowl and I have had no problems with leaking etc. I even wash the individual bowls in the dishwasher top rack but never the lids. Always wash the lids by hand. The only reason I am debuting one star is because I wish the food bowls were stainless as opposed to plastic.
customer_reviews.author: Madhu

customer_reviews.title: easy to bring but a little difficult to clean
customer_reviews.text: Zojirushi is a very famous brand. This is the most important reason I chose this kind of Lunch Jar. They are very easy to bring as lunch box but a little difficult to clean every day.
customer_reviews.author: Summer

customer_reviews.title: It makes taking lunch better than ordering in
customer_reviews.text: I get hot appetizing food exactly when I want it - no waiting for delivery. My lunches are an actual meal now! The thermal jar performs well if the food you put in it is hot, and you rinse it with hot water first. And it keeps cold meals well-chilled. The dishes microwave well. ( If you mess up your lids in the microwave, don't blame the product, as the instructions say not to microwave them.) It's a bit pricey at first, but if you figure saving at least 5 dollars a day it pays for itself within a month.
customer_reviews.author: Two Cents Ready

customer_reviews.title: After 12 years, I can finally have hot food while working!
customer_reviews.text: I work outside without the ability to heat up food in the middle of the day. This has allowed me to finally have hot meals while working. Things stay reasonably hot for about 6 hours.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph

customer_reviews.title: Every Day
customer_reviews.text: I love this product so much, it has really helped me get my diet under control. I prep all my meals the night before and take my bento box to work in the morning. I used to just grab whatever was in the fridge at the last minute. Because the product is compartmentalized I have a varied menu and I have to put more thought into what I should be eating. If you want to help yourself eat better, I couldn't reccoment this product more highly.
customer_reviews.author: Steph S.

customer_reviews.title: Did not work
customer_reviews.text: Tested it out and did not keep items cold or hot after 2 hours.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle P

customer_reviews.title: I'm a bit disappointed to see these aren't made in Japan anymore
customer_reviews.text: I'm a bit disappointed to see these aren't made in Japan anymore. Fantastic idea with a couple minor quibbles: 1. The insulated lid on the main container can be a real pain to get off. 2. There should be a pocket on the exterior to hold a water bottle. Or at least an aftermarket option for such a thing. 3. Doesn't work well with sandwiches. Otherwise, I use this thing everyday and heartily recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Danny S Taylor

customer_reviews.title: perfect themos lunch container
customer_reviews.text: perfect size for adult lunch, especially for typical Asian meal that has several dishes needed to be separated such as soup, rice, stir fried and veggie/fruits.
customer_reviews.author: Nam Dinh

customer_reviews.title: Best bento box I own
customer_reviews.text: I bought two other styles of bento boxes after this one, but this is the best. Compact, easy to clean, and has four containers. I've had soup spill out of a container when it tipped over, but it never escaped the outer shell. The carrying case is well made and I don't feel awkward carrying this to the office like I do with some of the others. The size of the containers also helps with portion control.
customer_reviews.author: Hardliner Bullet

customer_reviews.title: Nice Product!
customer_reviews.text: My bento box is great! If I could only force myself to stick to the portion sizes of the containers, Id probably be in better shape! LOL The quality of this lunch jar is excellent. Very well made. I wish they'd show a picture that shows all of the 4 bowls come with lids! This is very easy to clean, use, and tote. I am very happy with this and would recommend this to anyone looking to ditch their plastic containers or who dont have access to a micro or fridge during the day to keep their food.
customer_reviews.author: RS

customer_reviews.title: Big help in eating healthy
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this to prepare hot lunches for work. Start my rice cooker going along with my morning coffee, and by the time I'm showered and dressed it's ready for Mr. Bento. Keeps rice and soup/stew hot from about 7:30 until lunch-time. In fact, it's cooled off just enough by then that it's the perfect temperature to eat. So much better than going out for fast food or packing a cold sandwich! Much better even than one of those pre-packaged frozen meals in the microwave, since I know exactly what's in the food I make and I don't even have to wait the 3 minutes to nuke it.
customer_reviews.author: Dee Esme

customer_reviews.title: Too heavy and hard for even adults to pry open
customer_reviews.text: I got this due to the raving reviews. The product is of high quality, but it’s too heavy to carry around, and incredibly hard to open some of the compartments. Had to return this and go back to the simple Thermos jar.
customer_reviews.author: Lei Zhang

customer_reviews.title: うちの6歳の息子のお弁当箱
customer_reviews.text: As a Japanese family we trust zojirushi so much as it has never failed us. When we moved to the US and needed an obento box for my 6yo that will keep his food warm/cold when it's necessary. Although I wasn't sure whether to get tiger or zojirushi, I bought this product cause well, it's zojirushi! I just hope zojirushi USA's customer service is as good as Japan's. So far I don't see any problems since we've only had it for a day. I will update this review in the coming days.
customer_reviews.author: extrarice

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: I really like this lunch box set and making Bento is fun and easy! Now to keep my son from using it! Update: I bought a yellow one for me and my hubby uses this one. These are saving us so much money, not to mention the portion sizes are perfect. We use the bottom one for a huge bowl of oatmeal and then then next one for meat, then veggies, then fruit. We are looking great and feeling great!
customer_reviews.author: Sunny Smiles

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: This was the perfect lunchtime companion during my spouse's employment with UPS. I could easily pack some bread slices, tomato soup, rice, and chocolate. All together in the same container without fear of the chocolate melting or the soup going cold. It was a great way for me to pack a warm meal during those cold winter days.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Mc

customer_reviews.title: seems overpriced until you use it
customer_reviews.text: This unit is designed to handle a Japanese Bento plate. There are 2 warm (or cold) compartments and 2 room temperature compartments. The hot compartment is designed to hold the entree and soup. The other two is for the appetizer and the salad. The unit itself seems very sturdy, the only criticism is that the food containers themselves are plastic even though the main container is stainless steel.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: many containers
customer_reviews.text: The thermos holds the food hot. However it is not easy to get the container out without spilling the gravy or soup. It is better used for dry food.
customer_reviews.author: HERMINIA

customer_reviews.title: 😍Love it!!
customer_reviews.text: 😍I bought this for my husband's every day lunch, and it works really good, but you just need to make an adjustment choosing cold or hot food. Because if you put like hot soup on the bottom and salad or fruit on the top the fruit gets hot. 😕 Still love it, I usually prepare lunch at 5am and it keeps cool/hot until 2pm. Really good!!!😊
customer_reviews.author: SINDY

customer_reviews.title: Nice look and design
customer_reviews.text: The amount of food this thing holds is crazy! Nice look and design. Nice shoulder strap.
customer_reviews.author: Repeat Customer; WA, USA

product_meta.title: Zojirushi Mr. Bento Stainless Steel Lunch Jar, Silver
product_meta.description:
Color:Silver

ZOJIRUSHI MR. BENTO STAINLESS LUNCH JAR
LUNCH ON THE GO
Whether in the office or on the go, you can take a healthier, tastier, more interesting lunch with you thanks to Zojirushi's Mr. Bento Stainless Lunch Jar. One of the most versatile lunch boxes you'll ever come across, the Mr. Bento lunch jar comes with four different containers that allow you to pack a multi-course lunch of both hot and cold items easily and securely. The jar itself is made of stainless steel, is vacuum-insulated and houses four plastic containers with lids. The large soup bowl comes with gasket-sealed lid to prevent messy spills and is specially insulated to keep soup hot. All pieces should be washed by hand with non-abrasive cleaning pads. Inner bowls are microwave-safe. A spork with its own protective cover attaches to the Mr. Bento lunch jar, and the jar itself has its own lid with lock and comes in a zippered carry bag with a strap for easy transport. 

MR. BENTO FEATURES
 * Vacuum insulation keeps foods hot or cold for hours
 * Durable stainless steel construction with excellent heat retention
 * 4 microwaveable inner bowls
 * Washable nonstick coated outer container

GREAT FOR HOT OR COLD FOODS
SIDE BOWLS 
The Mr. Bento comes with two side bowls, one large 10.1-ounce and one small 6.8-ounce, that sit inside the lid. They are ideal for foods that should be kept room temperature, such as chips, nuts or snacks. The side bowls are not insulated.

MAIN BOWL
The 15.2-ounce main bowl is designed to hold the main course. The outer container's vacuum insulation and the insulated lid of the main bowl help keep foods hot or cold for hours without reheating or refrigeration.

SOUP BOWL
The 9-1/2-ounce soup bowl has a unique lid that minimizes leaks and is ideal for holding soups, dips, or fruit cocktail. It sits at the bottom of the outer container, where vacuum insulation keeps the foods hot or cold for hours.

VACUUM INSULATION
How does it keep food hot or cold? With Zojirushi's renowned vacuum insulation technology, air between the two thin layers of stainless steel on the outer container is removed, creating a vacuum. Because there is no air, the temperature on the outside does not transfer into the container; keeping foods hot or cold for hours.



WHAT'S IN THE BOX
Zippered carrying bag with strap; outer container with lock and lid; 6.8-ounce small side bowl with lid; 10.1-ounce large side bowl with lid; 15.2-ounce main bowl with lid; 9-1/2-ounce soup bowl with gasket, valve, and lid; forked spoon with cover and holder. 

Fun colors to choose from
feature_bullets: Round jar with 4 food bowls for hot or cold lunch storage
Vacuum-insulated stainless-steel construction keeps food warm
Easy-to-clean container washes quickly.Made of BPA-free plastic and stainless steel
Includes convenient carrying bag for transport.
